But it's good that they brought it to your attention so you can make it right. ### Neighbors A: Yeah, I know. I just don't know the best way to apologize. ### Neighbors B: Well, first you need to truly acknowledge what you did wrong and how it affected the other person. And then you can apologize and try to make it better. ### Neighbors A: That's a good point. Maybe I'll write them a letter or something. ### Neighbors B: That's a great idea. And if you need any help with it, feel free to ask me. Remember, apologizing is a sign of strength, not weakness.' }
